etymologies: mid 19th century. From post-classical Latin rhaponticum + -in, after German Rhaponticin

definitions: A yellow crystalline compound present in the root of a wild rhubarb, Rheum rhaponticum, and in some other plants.

notes.text: Rhaponticin is a glucoside related to stilbene. Chemical name: 4′-methoxy-3,3′,5-stilbenetriol 3-glucoside; C₂₁H₂₄O₉.
